meanings.definition: To make greater in power, influence, stature, or reputation.
meanings.sent1: She aggrandised her role in the school play by adding extra lines for herself.
meanings.sent2: The mayor aggrandised his authority by implementing new policies.
meanings.sent3: The cat aggrandised its hunting skills by catching a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun aggrandised the beauty of the landscape with its golden rays.
meanings.sent5: The teacher aggrandised the importance of studying for the upcoming test.

meanings.definition: To enhance or exaggerate the importance of something.
meanings.sent1: He aggrandised his achievements on his resume to impress potential employers.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement aggrandised the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent3: The child aggrandised the size of the fish they caught to impress their friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile aggrandised the joy of the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The artist aggrandised the beauty of the landscape in their painting.
